title: >>> DOUBLE Your FUN: Part II
body_text:
DODGEBALL XXX4 Records
> Attendance: 32
> Biggest Return: Gerald Lewis (Last played at DODGEBALL 27)
> New Players: (2) Dana L and Tom M
> DODGEBALL XXX4 saw teams assembled randomly by picking numbers (and captains cards) out of a hat. Due to this untraditional formation of teams, trading players was also added to the mix.
> The last [and only] time Dan Spengeman was captain was DODGEBALL 13 where he defeated Dan Karen in "The Battle of the Dans". For Justin Pierce, it was his first go at leading a team.
> For the second time in dodgeball history, the back tennis courts of Wall High School were used. This forced the return of human "rims".
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
DODGEBALL 35 Records
> Attendance: 26
> Biggest Returns: Matt Brown and Lindsay Cough (Last played at DODGEBALL XXV)
> New Players: (1) Christian
> DODGEBALL 35 is only the third event played on a Sunday, following DODGEBALL DAY 2 and DODGEBALL 30. It's only the second event to be played in the early afternoon, also following DODGEBALL 30.
> The promotional poster for DODGEBALL 35 is the only one in history to be changed after its public release.
> Because the first few games produced such slow action, "Prison Ball" made its return.
> John Tronolone finally ended his losing streak as captain when he defeated rival Kevin Fitzpatrick. John’s previous runs came at 9, 20, and 30, all of which he lost. "Fitz" moves to 1 and 1 after he beat Zach Katz at DODGEBALL 19 in mid-December.
> Ocean Road Park was jam-packed with spectators, many playing their own games. But upon the first rush, a good number of people noticeably stopped what they were doing to watch the intense dodgeball action.
> For only the second time ever, John Tronolone did not wear a WWE shirt. Instead, similarly to DODGEBALL 30, he wore a Pete and Elda's shirt. Interestingly, he never ate an pie to get the shirt as he dislikes the pizza at P&E's.
> After the event's end, a new game accurately coined by Steve Adams as "Concussion", was given its first try. The object of the game is to kick a "pain" ball as high as possible, with the nearest person planting their head underneath it.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
Due to the success of the above events [as well as many previous ones], the notion of perhaps the biggest "real" rivalry is being talked about more than ever. Whatever the case may be, expect plenty to be brought to the forefront very, very soon.
DODGEBALL 36, scheduled for April 22nd, is right now without a location due to mixed reactions concerning both venues.
Ocean Road Park
-VS-
Wall High School
Much more on this story in the coming week as it further develops ......

DODGEBALL XXX4 Records

> Attendance: 32

> Biggest Return: Gerald Lewis (Last played at DODGEBALL 27)

> New Players: (2) Dana L and Tom M

> DODGEBALL XXX4 saw teams assembled randomly by picking numbers (and captains cards) out of a hat. Due to this untraditional formation of teams, trading players was also added to the mix.

> The last [and only] time Dan Spengeman was captain was DODGEBALL 13 where he defeated Dan Karen in "The Battle of the Dans". For Justin Pierce, it was his first go at leading a team.

> For the second time in dodgeball history, the back tennis courts of Wall High School were used. This forced the return of human "rims".

~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

DODGEBALL 35 Records

> Attendance: 26

> Biggest Returns: Matt Brown and Lindsay Cough (Last played at DODGEBALL XXV)

> New Players: (1) Christian

> DODGEBALL 35 is only the third event played on a Sunday, following DODGEBALL DAY 2 and DODGEBALL 30. It's only the second event to be played in the early afternoon, also following DODGEBALL 30.

> The promotional poster for DODGEBALL 35 is the only one in history to be changed after its public release.

> Because the first few games produced such slow action, "Prison Ball" made its return.

> John Tronolone finally ended his losing streak as captain when he defeated rival Kevin Fitzpatrick. John’s previous runs came at 9, 20, and 30, all of which he lost. "Fitz" moves to 1 and 1 after he beat Zach Katz at DODGEBALL 19 in mid-December.

> Ocean Road Park was jam-packed with spectators, many playing their own games. But upon the first rush, a good number of people noticeably stopped what they were doing to watch the intense dodgeball action.

> For only the second time ever, John Tronolone did not wear a WWE shirt. Instead, similarly to DODGEBALL 30, he wore a Pete and Elda's shirt. Interestingly, he never ate an pie to get the shirt as he dislikes the pizza at P&E's.

> After the event's end, a new game accurately coined by Steve Adams as "Concussion", was given its first try. The object of the game is to kick a "pain" ball as high as possible, with the nearest person planting their head underneath it.

~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

Due to the success of the above events [as well as many previous ones], the notion of perhaps the biggest "real" rivalry is being talked about more than ever. Whatever the case may be, expect plenty to be brought to the forefront very, very soon.

DODGEBALL 36, scheduled for April 22nd, is right now without a location due to mixed reactions concerning both venues.

Ocean Road Park
-VS-
Wall High School

Much more on this story in the coming week as it further develops ......
